instructions.name: program_config_init
docs: Initialize the program config.

accounts.name: initializer
docs: The hard-coded account that is used to initialize the program config once.

instructions.name: program_config_set_authority
docs: Set the `authority` parameter of the program config.

instructions.name: program_config_set_multisig_creation_fee
docs: Set the `multisig_creation_fee` parameter of the program config.

instructions.name: program_config_set_treasury
docs: Set the `treasury` parameter of the program config.

instructions.name: multisig_create
docs: Create a multisig.

accounts.name: create_key
docs: An ephemeral signer that is used as a seed for the Multisig PDA.
Must be a signer to prevent front-running attack by someone else but the original creator.

accounts.name: creator
docs: The creator of the multisig.

instructions.name: multisig_create_v2
docs: Create a multisig.

accounts.name: program_config
docs: Global program config account.

accounts.name: treasury
docs: The treasury where the creation fee is transferred to.

accounts.name: create_key
docs: An ephemeral signer that is used as a seed for the Multisig PDA.
Must be a signer to prevent front-running attack by someone else but the original creator.

accounts.name: creator
docs: The creator of the multisig.

instructions.name: multisig_add_member
docs: Add a new member to the controlled multisig.

accounts.name: config_authority
docs: Multisig `config_authority` that must authorize the configuration change.

accounts.name: rent_payer
docs: The account that will be charged or credited in case the multisig account needs to reallocate space,
for example when adding a new member or a spending limit.
This is usually the same as `config_authority`, but can be a different account if needed.

accounts.name: system_program
docs: We might need it in case reallocation is needed.

instructions.name: multisig_remove_member
docs: Remove a member/key from the controlled multisig.

accounts.name: config_authority
docs: Multisig `config_authority` that must authorize the configuration change.

accounts.name: rent_payer
docs: The account that will be charged or credited in case the multisig account needs to reallocate space,
for example when adding a new member or a spending limit.
This is usually the same as `config_authority`, but can be a different account if needed.

accounts.name: system_program
docs: We might need it in case reallocation is needed.

instructions.name: multisig_set_time_lock
docs: Set the `time_lock` config parameter for the controlled multisig.

accounts.name: config_authority
docs: Multisig `config_authority` that must authorize the configuration change.

accounts.name: rent_payer
docs: The account that will be charged or credited in case the multisig account needs to reallocate space,
for example when adding a new member or a spending limit.
This is usually the same as `config_authority`, but can be a different account if needed.

accounts.name: system_program
docs: We might need it in case reallocation is needed.

instructions.name: multisig_change_threshold
docs: Set the `threshold` config parameter for the controlled multisig.

accounts.name: config_authority
docs: Multisig `config_authority` that must authorize the configuration change.

accounts.name: rent_payer
docs: The account that will be charged or credited in case the multisig account needs to reallocate space,
for example when adding a new member or a spending limit.
This is usually the same as `config_authority`, but can be a different account if needed.

accounts.name: system_program
docs: We might need it in case reallocation is needed.

instructions.name: multisig_set_config_authority
docs: Set the multisig `config_authority`.

accounts.name: config_authority
docs: Multisig `config_authority` that must authorize the configuration change.

accounts.name: rent_payer
docs: The account that will be charged or credited in case the multisig account needs to reallocate space,
for example when adding a new member or a spending limit.
This is usually the same as `config_authority`, but can be a different account if needed.

accounts.name: system_program
docs: We might need it in case reallocation is needed.

instructions.name: multisig_set_rent_collector
docs: Set the multisig `rent_collector`.

accounts.name: config_authority
docs: Multisig `config_authority` that must authorize the configuration change.

accounts.name: rent_payer
docs: The account that will be charged or credited in case the multisig account needs to reallocate space,
for example when adding a new member or a spending limit.
This is usually the same as `config_authority`, but can be a different account if needed.

accounts.name: system_program
docs: We might need it in case reallocation is needed.

instructions.name: multisig_add_spending_limit
docs: Create a new spending limit for the controlled multisig.

accounts.name: config_authority
docs: Multisig `config_authority` that must authorize the configuration change.

accounts.name: rent_payer
docs: This is usually the same as `config_authority`, but can be a different account if needed.

instructions.name: multisig_remove_spending_limit
docs: Remove the spending limit from the controlled multisig.

accounts.name: config_authority
docs: Multisig `config_authority` that must authorize the configuration change.

accounts.name: rent_collector
docs: This is usually the same as `config_authority`, but can be a different account if needed.

instructions.name: config_transaction_create
docs: Create a new config transaction.

accounts.name: creator
docs: The member of the multisig that is creating the transaction.

accounts.name: rent_payer
docs: The payer for the transaction account rent.

instructions.name: config_transaction_execute
docs: Execute a config transaction.
The transaction must be `Approved`.

accounts.name: multisig
docs: The multisig account that owns the transaction.

accounts.name: member
docs: One of the multisig members with `Execute` permission.

accounts.name: proposal
docs: The proposal account associated with the transaction.

accounts.name: transaction
docs: The transaction to execute.

accounts.name: rent_payer
docs: The account that will be charged/credited in case the config transaction causes space reallocation,
for example when adding a new member, adding or removing a spending limit.
This is usually the same as `member`, but can be a different account if needed.

accounts.name: system_program
docs: We might need it in case reallocation is needed.

instructions.name: vault_transaction_create
docs: Create a new vault transaction.

accounts.name: creator
docs: The member of the multisig that is creating the transaction.

accounts.name: rent_payer
docs: The payer for the transaction account rent.

instructions.name: vault_transaction_execute
docs: Execute a vault transaction.
The transaction must be `Approved`.

accounts.name: proposal
docs: The proposal account associated with the transaction.

accounts.name: transaction
docs: The transaction to execute.

instructions.name: batch_create
docs: Create a new batch.

accounts.name: creator
docs: The member of the multisig that is creating the batch.

accounts.name: rent_payer
docs: The payer for the batch account rent.

instructions.name: batch_add_transaction
docs: Add a transaction to the batch.

accounts.name: multisig
docs: Multisig account this batch belongs to.

accounts.name: proposal
docs: The proposal account associated with the batch.

accounts.name: transaction
docs: `VaultBatchTransaction` account to initialize and add to the `batch`.

accounts.name: member
docs: Member of the multisig.

accounts.name: rent_payer
docs: The payer for the batch transaction account rent.

instructions.name: batch_execute_transaction
docs: Execute a transaction from the batch.

accounts.name: multisig
docs: Multisig account this batch belongs to.

accounts.name: member
docs: Member of the multisig.

accounts.name: proposal
docs: The proposal account associated with the batch.
If `transaction` is the last in the batch, the `proposal` status will be set to `Executed`.

accounts.name: transaction
docs: Batch transaction to execute.

instructions.name: proposal_create
docs: Create a new multisig proposal.

accounts.name: creator
docs: The member of the multisig that is creating the proposal.

accounts.name: rent_payer
docs: The payer for the proposal account rent.

instructions.name: proposal_activate
docs: Update status of a multisig proposal from `Draft` to `Active`.

instructions.name: proposal_approve
docs: Approve a multisig proposal on behalf of the `member`.
The proposal must be `Active`.

instructions.name: proposal_reject
docs: Reject a multisig proposal on behalf of the `member`.
The proposal must be `Active`.

instructions.name: proposal_cancel
docs: Cancel a multisig proposal on behalf of the `member`.
The proposal must be `Approved`.

instructions.name: spending_limit_use
docs: Use a spending limit to transfer tokens from a multisig vault to a destination account.

accounts.name: multisig
docs: The multisig account the `spending_limit` is for.

accounts.name: spending_limit
docs: The SpendingLimit account to use.

accounts.name: vault
docs: Multisig vault account to transfer tokens from.

accounts.name: destination
docs: Destination account to transfer tokens to.

accounts.name: system_program
docs: In case `spending_limit.mint` is SOL.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The mint of the tokens to transfer in case `spending_limit.mint` is an SPL token.

accounts.name: vault_token_account
docs: Multisig vault token account to transfer tokens from in case `spending_limit.mint` is an SPL token.

accounts.name: destination_token_account
docs: Destination token account in case `spending_limit.mint` is an SPL token.

accounts.name: token_program
docs: In case `spending_limit.mint` is an SPL token.

instructions.name: config_transaction_accounts_close
docs: Closes a `ConfigTransaction` and the corresponding `Proposal`.
`transaction` can be closed if either:
- the `proposal` is in a terminal state: `Executed`, `Rejected`, or `Cancelled`.
- the `proposal` is stale.

accounts.name: transaction
docs: ConfigTransaction corresponding to the `proposal`.

accounts.name: rent_collector
docs: The rent collector.

instructions.name: vault_transaction_accounts_close
docs: Closes a `VaultTransaction` and the corresponding `Proposal`.
`transaction` can be closed if either:
- the `proposal` is in a terminal state: `Executed`, `Rejected`, or `Cancelled`.
- the `proposal` is stale and not `Approved`.

accounts.name: transaction
docs: VaultTransaction corresponding to the `proposal`.

accounts.name: rent_collector
docs: The rent collector.

instructions.name: vault_batch_transaction_account_close
docs: Closes a `VaultBatchTransaction` belonging to the `batch` and `proposal`.
`transaction` can be closed if either:
- it's marked as executed within the `batch`;
- the `proposal` is in a terminal state: `Executed`, `Rejected`, or `Cancelled`.
- the `proposal` is stale and not `Approved`.

accounts.name: batch
docs: `Batch` corresponding to the `proposal`.

accounts.name: transaction
docs: `VaultBatchTransaction` account to close.
The transaction must be the current last one in the batch.

accounts.name: rent_collector
docs: The rent collector.

instructions.name: batch_accounts_close
docs: Closes Batch and the corresponding Proposal accounts for proposals in terminal states:
`Executed`, `Rejected`, or `Cancelled` or stale proposals that aren't `Approved`.
This instruction is only allowed to be executed when all `VaultBatchTransaction` accounts
in the `batch` are already closed: `batch.size == 0`.

accounts.name: batch
docs: `Batch` corresponding to the `proposal`.

accounts.name: rent_collector
docs: The rent collector.

errors.name: DuplicateMember
errors.msg: Found multiple members with the same pubkey

errors.name: TooManyMembers
errors.msg: Too many members, can be up to 65535

errors.name: InvalidThreshold
errors.msg: Invalid threshold, must be between 1 and number of members with Vote permission

errors.name: Unauthorized
errors.msg: Attempted to perform an unauthorized action

errors.name: NotAMember
errors.msg: Provided pubkey is not a member of multisig

errors.name: NotSupportedForControlled
errors.msg: Instruction not supported for controlled multisig

errors.name: TimeLockNotReleased
errors.msg: Proposal time lock has not been released

errors.name: NoActions
errors.msg: Config transaction must have at least one action

errors.name: ProtectedAccount
errors.msg: Account is protected, it cannot be passed into a CPI as writable

errors.name: TimeLockExceedsMaxAllowed
errors.msg: Time lock exceeds the maximum allowed (90 days)

errors.name: IllegalAccountOwner
errors.msg: Account is not owned by Multisig program

errors.name: RentReclamationDisabled
errors.msg: Rent reclamation is disabled for this multisig

errors.name: TransactionNotLastInBatch
errors.msg: Transaction is not last in batch

fields.name: ephemeral_signers
docs: Number of ephemeral signing PDAs required by the transaction.

fields.name: vault_index
docs: Index of the vault this transaction belongs to.

fields.name: create_key
docs: Key that is used to seed the SpendingLimit PDA.

fields.name: vault_index
docs: The index of the vault that the spending limit is for.

fields.name: mint
docs: The token mint the spending limit is for.

fields.name: amount
docs: The amount of tokens that can be spent in a period.
This amount is in decimals of the mint,
so 1 SOL would be `1_000_000_000` and 1 USDC would be `1_000_000`.

fields.name: period
docs: The reset period of the spending limit.
When it passes, the remaining amount is reset, unless it's `Period::OneTime`.

fields.name: members
docs: Members of the multisig that can use the spending limit.
In case a member is removed from the multisig, the spending limit will remain existent
(until explicitly deleted), but the removed member will not be able to use it anymore.

fields.name: destinations
docs: The destination addresses the spending limit is allowed to sent funds to.
If empty, funds can be sent to any address.

fields.name: memo
docs: Memo is used for indexing only.

fields.name: memo
docs: Memo is used for indexing only.

fields.name: memo
docs: Memo is used for indexing only.

fields.name: memo
docs: Memo is used for indexing only.

fields.name: memo
docs: Memo is used for indexing only.

fields.name: memo
docs: Memo is used for indexing only.

fields.name: memo
docs: Memo is used for indexing only.

fields.name: config_authority
docs: The authority that can configure the multisig: add/remove members, change the threshold, etc.
Should be set to `None` for autonomous multisigs.

fields.name: threshold
docs: The number of signatures required to execute a transaction.

fields.name: members
docs: The members of the multisig.

fields.name: time_lock
docs: How many seconds must pass between transaction voting, settlement, and execution.

fields.name: memo
docs: Memo is used for indexing only.

fields.name: config_authority
docs: The authority that can configure the multisig: add/remove members, change the threshold, etc.
Should be set to `None` for autonomous multisigs.

fields.name: threshold
docs: The number of signatures required to execute a transaction.

fields.name: members
docs: The members of the multisig.

fields.name: time_lock
docs: How many seconds must pass between transaction voting, settlement, and execution.

fields.name: rent_collector
docs: The address where the rent for the accounts related to executed, rejected, or cancelled
transactions can be reclaimed. If set to `None`, the rent reclamation feature is turned off.

fields.name: memo
docs: Memo is used for indexing only.

fields.name: memo
docs: Memo is used for indexing only.

fields.name: authority
docs: The authority that can configure the program config: change the treasury, etc.

fields.name: multisig_creation_fee
docs: The fee that is charged for creating a new multisig.

fields.name: treasury
docs: The treasury where the creation fee is transferred to.

fields.name: transaction_index
docs: Index of the multisig transaction this proposal is associated with.

fields.name: draft
docs: Whether the proposal should be initialized with status `Draft`.

fields.name: amount
docs: Amount of tokens to transfer.

fields.name: decimals
docs: Decimals of the token mint. Used for double-checking against incorrect order of magnitude of `amount`.

fields.name: memo
docs: Memo used for indexing.

fields.name: vault_index
docs: Index of the vault this transaction belongs to.

fields.name: ephemeral_signers
docs: Number of ephemeral signing PDAs required by the transaction.

types.name: Permissions
docs: Bitmask for permissions.

fields.name: num_signers
docs: The number of signer pubkeys in the account_keys vec.

fields.name: num_writable_signers
docs: The number of writable signer pubkeys in the account_keys vec.

fields.name: num_writable_non_signers
docs: The number of writable non-signer pubkeys in the account_keys vec.

fields.name: account_keys
docs: Unique account pubkeys (including program IDs) required for execution of the tx.
The signer pubkeys appear at the beginning of the vec, with writable pubkeys first, and read-only pubkeys following.
The non-signer pubkeys follow with writable pubkeys first and read-only ones following.
Program IDs are also stored at the end of the vec along with other non-signer non-writable pubkeys:
```plaintext
[pubkey1, pubkey2, pubkey3, pubkey4, pubkey5, pubkey6, pubkey7, pubkey8]
|---writable---|  |---readonly---|  |---writable---|  |---readonly---|

fields.name: instructions
docs: List of instructions making up the tx.

fields.name: address_table_lookups
docs: List of address table lookups used to load additional accounts
for this transaction.

types.name: MultisigCompiledInstruction
docs: Concise serialization schema for instructions that make up a transaction.
Closely mimics the Solana transaction wire format.

fields.name: account_indexes
docs: Indices into the tx's `account_keys` list indicating which accounts to pass to the instruction.

fields.name: data
docs: Instruction data.

types.name: MultisigMessageAddressTableLookup
docs: Address table lookups describe an on-chain address lookup table to use
for loading more readonly and writable accounts into a transaction.

fields.name: account_key
docs: Address lookup table account key.

fields.name: writable_indexes
docs: List of indexes used to load writable accounts.

fields.name: readonly_indexes
docs: List of indexes used to load readonly accounts.

fields.name: create_key
docs: Key that is used to seed the SpendingLimit PDA.

fields.name: vault_index
docs: The index of the vault that the spending limit is for.

fields.name: mint
docs: The token mint the spending limit is for.

fields.name: amount
docs: The amount of tokens that can be spent in a period.
This amount is in decimals of the mint,
so 1 SOL would be `1_000_000_000` and 1 USDC would be `1_000_000`.

fields.name: period
docs: The reset period of the spending limit.
When it passes, the remaining amount is reset, unless it's `Period::OneTime`.

fields.name: members
docs: Members of the multisig that can use the spending limit.
In case a member is removed from the multisig, the spending limit will remain existent
(until explicitly deleted), but the removed member will not be able to use it anymore.

fields.name: destinations
docs: The destination addresses the spending limit is allowed to sent funds to.
If empty, funds can be sent to any address.

types.name: ProposalStatus
docs: The status of a proposal.
Each variant wraps a timestamp of when the status was set.

types.name: Period
docs: The reset period of the spending limit.

types.name: Batch
docs: Stores data required for serial execution of a batch of multisig vault transactions.
Vault transaction is a transaction that's executed on behalf of the multisig vault PDA
and wraps arbitrary Solana instructions, typically calling into other Solana programs.
The transactions themselves are stored in separate PDAs associated with the this account.

fields.name: multisig
docs: The multisig this belongs to.

fields.name: creator
docs: Member of the Multisig who submitted the batch.

fields.name: index
docs: Index of this batch within the multisig transactions.

fields.name: bump
docs: PDA bump.

fields.name: vault_index
docs: Index of the vault this batch belongs to.

fields.name: vault_bump
docs: Derivation bump of the vault PDA this batch belongs to.

fields.name: size
docs: Number of transactions in the batch.

fields.name: executed_transaction_index
docs: Index of the last executed transaction within the batch.
0 means that no transactions have been executed yet.

types.name: VaultBatchTransaction
docs: Stores data required for execution of one transaction from a batch.

fields.name: bump
docs: PDA bump.

fields.name: ephemeral_signer_bumps
docs: Derivation bumps for additional signers.
Some transactions require multiple signers. Often these additional signers are "ephemeral" keypairs
that are generated on the client with a sole purpose of signing the transaction and be discarded immediately after.
When wrapping such transactions into multisig ones, we replace these "ephemeral" signing keypairs
with PDAs derived from the transaction's `transaction_index` and controlled by the Multisig Program;
during execution the program includes the seeds of these PDAs into the `invoke_signed` calls,
thus "signing" on behalf of these PDAs.

fields.name: message
docs: data required for executing the transaction.

types.name: ConfigTransaction
docs: Stores data required for execution of a multisig configuration transaction.
Config transaction can perform a predefined set of actions on the Multisig PDA, such as adding/removing members,
changing the threshold, etc.

fields.name: multisig
docs: The multisig this belongs to.

fields.name: creator
docs: Member of the Multisig who submitted the transaction.

fields.name: index
docs: Index of this transaction within the multisig.

fields.name: bump
docs: bump for the transaction seeds.

fields.name: actions
docs: Action to be performed on the multisig.

fields.name: create_key
docs: Key that is used to seed the multisig PDA.

fields.name: config_authority
docs: The authority that can change the multisig config.
This is a very important parameter as this authority can change the members and threshold.
The convention is to set this to `Pubkey::default()`.
In this case, the multisig becomes autonomous, so every config change goes through
the normal process of voting by the members.
However, if this parameter is set to any other key, all the config changes for this multisig
will need to be signed by the `config_authority`. We call such a multisig a "controlled multisig".

fields.name: threshold
docs: Threshold for signatures.

fields.name: time_lock
docs: How many seconds must pass between transaction voting settlement and execution.

fields.name: transaction_index
docs: Last transaction index. 0 means no transactions have been created.

fields.name: stale_transaction_index
docs: Last stale transaction index. All transactions up until this index are stale.
This index is updated when multisig config (members/threshold/time_lock) changes.

fields.name: rent_collector
docs: The address where the rent for the accounts related to executed, rejected, or cancelled
transactions can be reclaimed. If set to `None`, the rent reclamation feature is turned off.

fields.name: bump
docs: Bump for the multisig PDA seed.

fields.name: members
docs: Members of the multisig.

types.name: ProgramConfig
docs: Global program configuration account.

fields.name: authority
docs: The authority which can update the config.

fields.name: multisig_creation_fee
docs: The lamports amount charged for creating a new multisig account.
This fee is sent to the `treasury` account.

fields.name: treasury
docs: The treasury account to send charged fees to.

fields.name: reserved
docs: Reserved for future use.

types.name: Proposal
docs: Stores the data required for tracking the status of a multisig proposal.
Each `Proposal` has a 1:1 association with a transaction account, e.g. a `VaultTransaction` or a `ConfigTransaction`;
the latter can be executed only after the `Proposal` has been approved and its time lock is released.

fields.name: multisig
docs: The multisig this belongs to.

fields.name: transaction_index
docs: Index of the multisig transaction this proposal is associated with.

fields.name: status
docs: The status of the transaction.

fields.name: bump
docs: PDA bump.

fields.name: approved
docs: Keys that have approved/signed.

fields.name: rejected
docs: Keys that have rejected.

fields.name: cancelled
docs: Keys that have cancelled (Approved only).

fields.name: multisig
docs: The multisig this belongs to.

fields.name: create_key
docs: Key that is used to seed the SpendingLimit PDA.

fields.name: vault_index
docs: The index of the vault that the spending limit is for.

fields.name: mint
docs: The token mint the spending limit is for.
Pubkey::default() means SOL.
use NATIVE_MINT for Wrapped SOL.

fields.name: amount
docs: The amount of tokens that can be spent in a period.
This amount is in decimals of the mint,
so 1 SOL would be `1_000_000_000` and 1 USDC would be `1_000_000`.

fields.name: period
docs: The reset period of the spending limit.
When it passes, the remaining amount is reset, unless it's `Period::OneTime`.

fields.name: remaining_amount
docs: The remaining amount of tokens that can be spent in the current period.
When reaches 0, the spending limit cannot be used anymore until the period reset.

fields.name: last_reset
docs: Unix timestamp marking the last time the spending limit was reset (or created).

fields.name: bump
docs: PDA bump.

fields.name: members
docs: Members of the multisig that can use the spending limit.
In case a member is removed from the multisig, the spending limit will remain existent
(until explicitly deleted), but the removed member will not be able to use it anymore.

fields.name: destinations
docs: The destination addresses the spending limit is allowed to sent funds to.
If empty, funds can be sent to any address.

types.name: VaultTransaction
docs: Stores data required for tracking the voting and execution status of a vault transaction.
Vault transaction is a transaction that's executed on behalf of the multisig vault PDA
and wraps arbitrary Solana instructions, typically calling into other Solana programs.

fields.name: multisig
docs: The multisig this belongs to.

fields.name: creator
docs: Member of the Multisig who submitted the transaction.

fields.name: index
docs: Index of this transaction within the multisig.

fields.name: bump
docs: bump for the transaction seeds.

fields.name: vault_index
docs: Index of the vault this transaction belongs to.

fields.name: vault_bump
docs: Derivation bump of the vault PDA this transaction belongs to.

fields.name: ephemeral_signer_bumps
docs: Derivation bumps for additional signers.
Some transactions require multiple signers. Often these additional signers are "ephemeral" keypairs
that are generated on the client with a sole purpose of signing the transaction and be discarded immediately after.
When wrapping such transactions into multisig ones, we replace these "ephemeral" signing keypairs
with PDAs derived from the MultisigTransaction's `transaction_index` and controlled by the Multisig Program;
during execution the program includes the seeds of these PDAs into the `invoke_signed` calls,
thus "signing" on behalf of these PDAs.

fields.name: message
docs: data required for executing the transaction.
